author: big_tech_sux
content: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10743 i've updated EIP-7923 to remove the secondary hot pages counter, simplifying the EIP and specification.

author: big_tech_sux
content: I'll also be making an update to eip 7907 to include the codesize in the account tuple so we don't need the ghost index

author: christine_dkim
content: no planned breaks for the acdt calls during devconnect, right?

author: christine_dkim
content:
in case helpful, here's one visualization of the level of support expressed for each of the eips discussed on yesterday's call! ssz eips got the highest number of individuals saying they were against, and core repricing eips + eip 8024  got the highestnumber of individuals saying they were for. 
https://x.com/christine_dkim/status/1986895453594796086

author: .paulharris
content:
Just flagging an eth_getBlobsV2 observation here, I'm not sure it's a huge thing currently...
I've been looking at our grafana dash a lot testing things, and noticed an increase at bpo1 on hoodi with the time taken to service the request. We're running 3 EL, and noticed large increases when using geth or besu post BPO1. Nethermind seemed to not change its response time.
The second is a longer duration across sepolia, and the trend is uppish but doesnt jump in the way that hoodi nodes seemed to.
We might want to keep an eye on this response time as we scale...

author: _shemnon
content: The storage size gas schedule change (EIP-8032) also has an account tuple change, so we need to make sure these mesh. Maybe reference their rules?  And decide if it's updated on storage size changes or when the code is loaded via execution or EXTCODE query. We may need a clearer definition of "affected accounts"
